text: We just got back from a week here with a 14 year old daughter and 11 year old son.We had a very positive stay, not without negatives as with most things but a very well ran lovely hotel.There were no issues getting sunbeds, I‚Äôd even bought some lightweight travel ones in anticipation but it was not an issue. The flumes were great, enough even for our adrenaline loving teen. There were plenty of daytime activities, a shame our 14 and 11 year old couldn‚Äôt join in the stuff we did like darts etc as was minimum age 15 and they were not interested in a teens club. But there was lots to do and whilst there were rep exercises and routine, there wasn‚Äôt that annoying repeated theme song of the holiday type thing pounding multiple times per day that you get in some places.The staff were fab. Hard working, constant removing used cups and plates in restaurant and bar etc. there was never a long wait at any of the bars and decent brand drinks.The food was fine. Not as plentiful in choice as appears as there are duplicates stations. But plenty of salads and desserts and them themes each night for mains. Sometimes some was like warm especially eggs and beans at breakfast, which is strange as was so busy they must have been constantly replenishing. We could even get Prosecco/cava at breakfast! As we were there a week we got 2 free vouchers for the other restaurants. We left it too late so onlyManaged to get in the Brazilian on our last night but wow it was worth it. Intimate, lovely decor and good service and loads of meat for our carnivorous family!The entertainment was not for us. In a kind of marquee and way too cheesy for us and our older kids, definitely aimed at younger. The main bar was reallyJust a lounge/lobby near reception which was fine but could have done with some atmosphere. Why there was the odd live performer in a tiny tent round the back of the pool where no one knew there was seating, I don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs very windy at night and you wouldn‚Äôt want to sit outside. Would‚Äôve been lovely to have had that kind of entertainment or light ambience in the lobby lounge.Family room was disappointing. It was a normal room with a sofa bed. Noisy and cramped and I‚Äôd say not appropriate for 2 adults and 14 and 11 year old girl and boy.  That is my only real criticism.I used the gym and it‚Äôs well equipped although no air con and one treadmill only worked. The lifts were useful so I don‚Äôt know why people are reviewing that badly. Put in your floor and it tells you which lift to get. Saves people stopping on every single floor, we were on the top floor, number 10 of 10 so were grateful for this!Overall a great hotel, lovely weather, nos mosquitoes which was such a relief when myself and the kids get eaten alive usually, and a great location away from the tacky strip and walkingDistance if you‚Äôre up for it, to the town and beach but a free shuttle if not. We would go back although would get 2 rooms I think.

Closest hotel to the centre of Funchal - everything is within walking distance (most hotels are set miles to the West of Funchal). Moden, very clean but above all one of the most helpful hotels I have ever stayed in. No request was too much trouble and the staff all genuinely care about the guests enjoyment - there's plenty of 5* hotels that could learn from this hidden gemDanielLondon

Fantastic hotel  very clean  food was great plenty of choice for such a big hotel . Travelled alone with my son the manager always asked if I was ok as my son has autism and adhd cleaners were so helpful always there if needed anything can now see why my son goes every year with his dad as he says can‚Äôt wait to go back in October great holiday thanks so much Jupiter would return again

This hostel felt like home from the first moment. The guest house is cozy, there is a big garden (fruittrees! swing! hammock!) and there are many places to sit down and enjoy the silence, the atmosphere and the view on the fields. It's highly recommended to visit this place by car, so you can easily discover the area and go to the beach.Best thing about this place though, more then the hostel itself, are the people. A warm family, friendly, open, and always willing to make your visit as good as possible. Maria Mar is absolutely worth a visit!

Gorgeous rooms and hotel in general, so clean throughout! The food and restaurant was lovely. The staff were very friendly. Pool was fab, drinks were great and we can‚Äôt wait to return, we could of stayed for much much longer ü§©ü§©

Rude and arrogant staff at check-in (the two guys are sitting, but they are not offering seats to guests at check-in. It's more like checking in to a prison), rooms are extremely dark, insufficient lights, small windows (and stupidly with dark interiors). Atmosphere at breakfast like a canteen, staff not really friendly. Quality of food at breakfast is okay, but very very limited choice. Definitely not to recommend.THE HOTEL HAS A SEVERE HYGIENE ISSUE:The slippers in the room are not changed (I went to the reception when I saw the used slippers in my room and they confirmed: yes, they are reused without getting cleaned, meaning you are wearing slippers other people used before. That's a disgrace, disgusting and unhygienic.My shower was dirty, covered by black mold everywhere. I went to the reception to let them know, luckily at least they tried to clean afterwards (unfortunately not successfully, because the mould obviously has been there for ages already).And imagine: even the amenities in my room have also been already used.When I went to the reception to complain about the problems in my room the guy showed me by his face expression that he doesn't care at all. There was no reaction from his side, just ignorance. I had to talk with someone from the management to get my room finally cleaned.I would never go there again. It's probably the most expensive hotel in Braga, but it's simply a tourist trap.

Having just returned from a stay I would say that we were disappointed with the hotel. This hot has many positives however it has negatives to go along with it.Positives. Hotel was absolutely spotlessly clean and all the communal and pool areas were very well maintained. Staff were all extremely welcoming and nothing too much trouble. It was serviced daily and maintained to a good standard. It's only a 5 minute walk to the start of the strip, which was quite convenient if you wanted to escape the hotel.Negatives. Having read many positive reviews about the food I must say I was very underwhelmed!Food was often lukewarm and like previous reviews mentioned, required the use of microwaves to get it hot. Maybe a contributing issue is that the main restaurant was open from breakfast till very late at night and a lot of the produce like meats and fish seemed to be cooked and then left stacked under hot lights for long periods of time. The pool snack bar opens 11am-6pm but only offers cold food like sandwiches and salads. The hot food snack bar next to the main buffet restaurant doesn‚Äôt open until 3.30pm but even when it did open none of the food was hot! This is so disappointing from a 5 star hotel! Due to this we decided to eat out for our meals most of our holiday! I was surprised to see the absence of any fresh cooked station, like an omelette station in a morning or BBQ in the evening, which I would expect to see in 5* accommodationI can't comment on the 2 onsite restaurants as we unfortunately didn‚Äôt use these!The entertainment tent is a silly set up, set up like a school assembly hall.The kids club kids over 3 aren‚Äôt allowed a parent to wait meaning my little girl didn‚Äôt want to stay on her own. There was no arcade or anything for the kids either. The indoor pool is part of the spa meaning you have to pay to use. This meant on the days the weather wasn‚Äôt great there was nothing to do apart from venture outside the hotel.The rooms were very clean but we felt they were a tad on the small side especially for families.This hotel has put me off staying 5 star again!

The transfer from Funchal Airport to the Savoy Saccharum takes an hour.  The hotel is situated beside the ocean on the edge of the seaside resort of Calheta. High cliffs rise opposite the hotel which has been cleverly designed to provide ocean views from the balconies of all of the rooms that naturally face towards the cliffs.The local supermarket and a small number of shops are just a pleasant five minute walk away along the harbour front, which itself is worth visiting - at least four different businesses offer food and drink in the harbour complex. At their rear there are two other restaurants immediately beneath the cliffs and Calheta's second hotel is at the other side of the harbour facing the supermarket and shops.If you want a hotel out of the city, but which has nearly every modern facility then the Savoy Saccharum is well worth a visit. The entrance is roomy, kept beautifully clean and sits proudly facing towards the ocean. Inside the hotel is again spacious, cool and clean. Reception staff have a great range of languages and are smart, efficient and hospitable - couldn't fault them.Our room was on the sixth floor. As soon as we opened the door we loved the character of the room and the fact that it had a classy, modern appearance with a toilet and bidet, separate shower area and a sink/dressing area which opened into the bedroom. Our lovely balcony with table and two chairs was behind the glass patio doors that formed the room's exterior.The only disappointment was the terrible television reception. Although approx. 80 channels are theoretically available, frequently the signal failed and the picture froze - quite often for up to a minute or more. This makes it very hard to follow anything of interest be it the news, a film etc.A kettle, small fridge, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space, as well as a desk area, an easy chair, a hardback chair and a double bench were also available for our use. The room was spotlessly clean and remained so throughout, with the only disappointing service evident on the day our regular very kind female cleaner was replaced by a male (who forgot to leave soap, toilet rolls etc).Every effort is made in the main dining area to provide a variety of meals, both at breakfast and at night. A full range of continental offerings was provided every day, as was a choice of fried, scrambled, boiled eggs, with small sausages, bacon, tomato, mushrooms and beans. The bread offered by the hotel was always beautifully fresh - and very moorish!A lovely lady cooks omelettes and crepes to order every day - she works non stop, yet remains very graceful - you could say swan like. I never heard anyone complain about her crepes or omelettes and many of the same people came back day after day.In the evenings there are always at least two types of fish and two types of meat dishes - quite often three of each - to choose from. A chef is on station in the side (crepes) area at night cooking quick meals and always has chips on offer as well. Again a full array of cold meats, salads etc is also available and the sweets served each night are far too tempting and taste wonderful. The only downside of the evening meal was the fact that neither tea nor coffee is routinely dispensed.Generally the table service is very good. A number of members of staff are of a very high standard and could clearly get work at any good hotel they chose to apply for. Others struggle a little, but a good to high standard is maintained by the hotel's duty maitre d's who not only meet and greet guests, but also keep a wary eye on staff.For those wanting to eat a la carte and who are already paying for half board they can, providing they give at least 24 hours notice, opt to eat in the hotel's other restaurant where an allowance of 13 Euros will be given per guest towards the cost of their evening meal. I seem to recall that typically a main meal in this restaurant would be around 14 Euros, but you should check first.The hotel offers a number of bars, a choice of swimming pools and a gymnasium.Car hire can be arranged from the hotel or a few hundred yards along at the harbour. If you hire at the hotel you are able to park the hire vehicle in the hotel's crowded outdoor car park (6.50 Euros/night) or in the comfort of the underground garage (7.50 Euros/night). You can park out on the main road for nothing - dependent on times and parking restrictions, but our understanding was that only cars hired via the hotel would be allowed to park on the premises.There are probably cheaper car hire deals to be had in Funchal, but we liked the convenience of dealing with the Savoy's excellent reception staff and the lady from the Why Not car hire company who brought our vehicle to us.Madeira is a mountainous island with a number of challenging roads and tunnels. In some places the roads are narrow and hug cliff edges - those with a nervous disposition may be better considering a short break in Lincolnshire or the Vale of York!We were pleased that we had chosen the Savoy Saccharum, that we had travelled with Jet 2 (good outgoing and return flight times) and had spent a week on a very beautiful and fertile island.Once again we found the Portuguese people to be the most welcoming of hosts.
What a nice hotel this is. Our flat was great with 50\ tellies in every room
month: a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher and a washing machine. Everywhere was spotlessly clean
year: and the staff were most pleasant. I read the reviews of a few people who ate at the hotel
extracted_date_str: but we did not do this
extracted_date: preferring to wander around the town and strip
year_int: sampling various foods available at a myriad of restaurants. The pool is pristine
column12: so you don't have to walk far for refreshments."

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Best Hotel I have stayed in anywhere. Staff delightful from start to finish. Decor understated and classy. Fabulous breakfast buffet. No musak. Just a wonderful, memorable 3 day stay at a superb location. Thank you to the Manager and his quality team.

One of the most comfortable rooms I have ever been in.  Great beds - could snuggle right in!  Large modern apartment with well equipped kitchenette and large modern bathroom.  Plenty of hot water and everything was sparkling clean.  One of the best locations in Porto - between the river and the market hall.  Easy to get anywhere.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent value.

Dixo's Hostel is the place to stay if your traveling to Porto we had an awesome time there the rooms and facilities are really good, the staff are super friendly and helpful ! Location a really good I Didn't wanna leave ! ! and i will definalty go back ther one day :) Thanks for a great trip

They say the most important part in any home/hotel is location and you can not fault this hotel for that. Close to the cathedral castle and centre of Alfama it‚Äôs also close to restaurants and the river.But.Breakfast is honestly the worst I have ever had in Portugal. Although the bread is good there is little other choice. A small plate of cheese and meat is begrudgingly handed out with 4 pats of butter and the look you get when you ask for more butter. I felt like Oliver! Please sir can I have some more.Room was compact and air conditioned but no TV or coffee making facilities.On suite was very compact. Luckily I had lost a bit of weight because of the lack of breakfast. Have I mentioned how bad the breakfast was! Go to the hotel Paris is Porto for a breakfast! And a half!Staff friendly apart from breakfast waitress.Nice courtyard to sit out in and breakfast terrace also good unlike the breakfast.No views from either but I would imagine they would be cool in the height of summer.It‚Äôs my last day in the hotel so I went round to the butchers yesterday evening to get some ham and salami to add to the morsal provided by the hotel. At lease I can make one decent breakfast.A

Reserved room mid-January via Expedia. Arrived hotel by 1:00pm. They charged us and then told us they were overbooked. No prior notice. Put us in a taxi to a lesser hotel and location. No form of refund from hotel. Expedia offered $50 USD \credit\"."

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: We came to Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites expecting a family friendly place. We expect kids and what kids do as neighbors. What made it a downer for us was the hotel's inability to do the small things to help. The doors close with a loud thud...and if your neighbor's kids are up at 7am.....or if they are up till late and running down the hall it would seem you have no doors at all. Again, this is the hotel's job to invest in. Small miss in a lovely environment ‚Äì sure, but an important one if you came her to relax.The front desk staff are not well trained. We saw the difference having arrived here from Sheraton Lisboa where everyone was on the same page and the hand-offs were smooth. At Pine Cliffs one person tells us to go to the DJ show and the other person tells us there isn't one (or let me check and call you back....and then no call for 10-minutes....how long should it take?).My wife and I are both Platinum with Ambassador service. Our Ambassador told us breakfast is included in the room. When we checked in we were helped by two from desk team members. Katarina thought the breakfast is not included. And that she would check with her manager and let us know. For the \Luxury Collection\" property
month: is it the training or the staff themselves? As team leaders and skill developers we often wonder about the source of incompetence. This needs to be looked at by Mr. Thomas Schoen
year: the GM if he truly wants to give his patrons the experience they are visiting for. We received an invite through the door to join him for welcome drinks on one of the weekdays
extracted_date: we had to be on the road by then. Had we stayed through it
year_int: we would have shared our notes with him in person.We had dinner at the Mare by the sea one of our nights. Bruno couldn't be more inviting
column12: attentive and gets five stars from us. Now there is the kind of service and support everyone will appreciate. The food was so-so. And yet
column13: we would say it was a fabulous experience. Great work Bruno.The beach:The Spa: it is inviting and we did go in. There were two couples ahead of us waiting to be checked in. The lady helping the couple ahead of us kept mentioning the price (‚ÄúEuro 500 for two of you‚Äù) but not answering their questions in detail on what to expect. They walked out and we followed.P.S. We were finally able to figure out that the breakfast was included but there was a miscommunication there too. Overall
column14: the experience wasn‚Äôt the Luxury Collection we were anticipating. The GM
column16: has a lot of work to do before Pine Cliffs will match what it claims to be. Look elsewhere until then."

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: This place is amazing! Suites are super modern and super functional. Kitchen is very modern fully equipped and functional. Bed linens are luxurious and comfortable. Location is the best... on the beach and around you can find all nice restaurants and beaches. We are coming back for sure for years to come. Only thing to add I wish that Front Desk team was more friendly ( they would never greet when you are passing in the lobby )..... it felt like they are working at the airport check in, however bell team is nice, police, guest oriented, smiling and greeting all the time.... must add very good-looking too!

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Superb hotel. Great location close to the beach ..the food was wonderful very very helpful staff. 16 of us went for a 5 day break and every person wants to return...there are lovely bars and good restaurants next to the hotel just a minutes walk,,  live music each night great atmosphere,,,we played San lorenzo , villamoura old and Quinta South course ,,each course stunning and all different layouts,,great welcome each time but in my opinion if I had to play only one course each week it would be Quinta South.  It's a dream

My husband & I stayed for a week during July 2024. We were in Room 66 which was more of an apartment, we had our own terrace with table & chairs, coffee table & 2 x sunloungers - very private & had sun in afternoons. Hotel is small but very nice with lovely staff - Carla is great & very helpful. Pool is lovely & a real suntrap & sunbeds always available, no getting up at 7am to grab!! Hotel even provides beach towels! Hotel in a good location from the old town square, approx 10min walk, BUT be warned, do not take high heels as walk is cobbly & steep. Also take a long sleeve top as evenings may be a bit chilly. There is a coffee shop opposite (Leo's) who does a lovely coffee & breakfast, there is also a lovely restaurant next door to the hotel which does a fantastic seafood pasta. Rooms have kettle, microwave, 2-ring hob & is well equipped with everything needed to cook including tea towels. The only items not provided were washing-up liquid & a kitchen sponge, but we always take those anyway. Overall, a fantastic hotel & would thoroughly recommend.

The best hospitality in Lisbon They are like family to me.  I have grown to know this staff over the course of the last 4 years.  They have received me and my family with open arms.  The staff are not only professional but have wonderful souls.  The front desk and guest relations have an incredible level of high standards and are very personable as well. This made our stay that much more special because of the continuation of regards towards my family.  They are very wonderful people.  Treat them right and they'll give you the world...lol

I did a lot of research for my Portugal surf trip and booked in here. I travel a lot and have to say this is one of the best. We did the surf package and the whole experience was excellent, an amazing beach, brilliant and professional surf instructors, a great hostel and great staff who work hard to help you enjoy your time. My only criticism would be the beds are a little bit like someone has left a spanner or two in the mattress but other than that, I am definitely heading back and looking into organising a college surf trip there next year. Long live Rich's tuna!!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The property is beautiful and the staff is remarkable. I‚Äôve never been treated better anywhere in the world. It‚Äôs the best hotel experience in Funchal. Even the locals say nothing compared to Reid‚Äôs Palace.

I am a Platinum Elite Level Marriot Customer and have therefore experienced Marriot Hotels all over the world. I can confirm without equivocation that this is the worst Marriot Hotel I have ever stayed in. From the check in process which included a longer than usual wait time even though we had checked in on the mobile app the day before and the hotel supposedly had a dedicated Elite Level Desk (which for some reason was used for everyone else. The check in staff didn't even bother to ask me if I was Elite Level before telling me to wait for another guest. Perhaps he assumed I could not be because I was of African descent!) to the air conditioners that made awful noises all through the day and night. A complaint about the long check in and lack of priority service was met with a bland and defensive response from the front desk manager. We asked for a connecting room as we had booked 2 rooms as we were travelling with our 3 children. This was not to be. We were given rooms though on the same floor but with the intercom in the other room not functioning until we begged for it to be fixed (after several visits down the hall). I had to go to the lobby at 3am to complain and what was worse, they already knew about the problem! The technician offered to switch off my air conditioning as a solution (which was obviously not acceptable in the Portuguese heat wave). It was our first visit to Lisbon and Portugal and this is not a place I would recommend for anyone for vacation or business. The hotel is in dire need of renovation and it is a shame that Marriot lends it's name to such a property. Never again.

We stayed at the Marriott in Lisbon last week.  We really enjoyed it as we usually don't stay in such nice places.  The bed was really big.  We had an extra bed put in for our 2 children.  My parents treated us with their points for the room.  The taxi fares in Lisbon are so inexpensive! I couldn't believe it.  From downtown to our hotel it was barely 5 Euro! We did buy a pass for the metro but after seeing how cheap the taxi's are I think I would take a taxi to get around. Much faster and easier when travelling with a bigger group.Everyone was nice at the Marriott. Plus since we travelled with my parents we were able to use the Executive Lounge on the 17th floor.  They always had snacks and free internet and drinks.We did order room service one night for one of my sons.  The hamburger was 8 Euro but came with fries and it was a good hamburger.  Of course there was an extra fee of 2,50 for the service but that was okay.I would stay there again if I went back.

We have taken mid summer city breaks for many years but never before in Portugal. This was our first trip to Lisbon and we thoroughly enjoyed it , even if it was exceptionally hot and packed with tourists. (like us). What made it so special was our stay at the Porto Bay.The hotel is centrally placed 10 mins walk from the old city or just a few few minutes to the nearest Metro station . Its modern, comfortable, with a roof top bar and pleasant dining room . It lives up to its rating. However the staff are brilliant and they set the place apart from most others we have stayed at. Nothing is too much trouble for them , whether its the bar staff, reception , doorman or cleaner, everyone is courteous and do their best for you to enjoy your stay. We would recommend this hotel to everyone .

Arrived back home from FSF today, 24/02/2013We stay for 2 weeks, as we have done for approx 16 years. Our Villa overlooks the golf course and inkeeping with the continual maintainace and improvements programme, has had a recent re-vamp.With new flooring upstairs, tiling in bathrooms, new electrics and ovens, etc. Lovely touches and lots of new plants.Fresh flowers make a lovely welcome.Big thank you to Jorge, Rui and managment team for the improvements.Also to Vicky in the Clubhouse who always makes us welcome and Carlos in the restaurant for the lovley SMILE and HUGS of welcome and good service from everyone.We will be returning again next year - can not wait. Booking the flights already!

We stayed the third time in this Hotel and had a wonderfull stay. the stuff was yery friendly.we come again. beautiful located and Close to the town. The capucino during breakfirst could be better.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The hotel is stunning and well kept for the most part, but we won‚Äôt be returning due to service levels.  I understand there are cultural differences and COVID challenges, but a coffee and light breakfast should not take 1.5+ hours and six flag downs of a server (because otherwise you are completely ignored), EVERY DAY.  Throughout the hotel and room little petty things I would normally brush off just kept adding up.  The menus are almost identical at every restaurant on property, we deserted those pretty quickly in favor of several other fabulous restaurants within walking distance.  Beware the premium experience, almost none of the advertised amenities are actually available or worthwhile.  We addressed all of these issues with staff during our stay but were not provided any sort of resolution or improvement, only apologies.

lovely hotel fabulous location. All staff are courteous and very pleasant. The hotel is getting a complete overhaul and refurbishment over the winter   I look forward to seeing it most rooms have spectacular views over the cove and out to sea.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Maybe I am too picky. After spending 5 days at the 4 Season in Lisbon and 5 days at the Intercontinental in Porto, where everyone down to the the maintenance staff in the hall greets you with a smile and could not be more helpful, I was sadly underwhelmed by the service at the Reids even after gratuities were given.I expect the following efficient reception and check in receiving the precise reservation ,we have made given advance communications. - I have to say this was the bright spot they did, come through  here. RECEPTION/CHECK-IN is excellent and deserves their 5 star reputation.I further expect a knowledgeable -helpful concierge- who assist with sightseeing suggestion, Dinner suggestion and reservations  off premise and other issue. I found this service lacking even as I added after gratuities. Even one gentleman  initially REFUSED assistance until .I commented that my mother had been there last year and raved about the place.Pool staff initially told us to \do it our-self\" with the chairs and umbrella
month: 2 euros and insistence reluctantly changed his attitude.The staff in the breakfast room I will say was a EXCELLENT.I must say we tipped throughout Portugal and where in Lisbon and Porto SERVICE excitement to help foreigners (down to a public bus driver) and share their country was offered prior to gratuity
year: I found the certain individuals at the REID very very reluctant to do what I perceive was their JOB."

text: We were here for 5 nights in February on our first trip to Madeira and I am very pleased we decided to book this hotel. Its in a quiet location, ideal for the walking and relaxing we had planned. The hotel is dark with a sensual feel, and would say a sea view room is a must. I was interested to see what the bathroom situation would be like and would say I am glad I was with my husband rather than friends.We were half board and I enjoyed the breakfast and evening buffet, however from my experience of this calibre of hotel the food standard of some dishes was not great. The service in the restaurant was the best in the hotel, I felt the service in other areas of the hotel lacked the same authenticity. The housekeeping was another area that was great most of the time but questionable at other times. These were the niggles that led to 4 rather than five stars for this review, ultimately its a great hotel in a most beautiful location that I would recommend.I would also recommend a spa treatment (if that's your thing)  and making most of the use of the spa area for a few hours as its an amazing space but an extra cost without a treatment.Things I found useful - the hotel bus to Funchal, a supermarket a short walk away, just opposite the other savoy hotel (useful for getting our water), the sugar cane factory we found it on one of our walks, small but interesting. Flat shoes, most of the walking involved the steepest of hills in hot sunshine.

Overall we had a pleasant experience.The check-in process was smooth, and the staff were kind and welcoming.The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, and the room was quiet, making for a restful night.The location was convenient, and parking was easy to find.The breakfast was decent, though I would rate it a 3.5 out of 5.The light tan carpets in the halls were stained throughout giving a dingy appearance, unfortunate for a newer hotel.

We stayed in the hotel for 10 days in november 2015. Everything was ok, in some aspects more than this. Polite staff at the front desk, also in the restaurant, the price was totally ok for that, the hotel offeres.But there is one little problem. The hotel is getting older and you can see it. You can hear the noise from the rooms around, especially by night, you hear the noise when neighbours shut their door, you hear the toilet flushing and the airconditioning is too loud. Perhaps in a different room it might be better .Summery: We lived in hotels that were much more expensive and there it was not more silence by night than it was here. We lived in this hotel surely for the 10th time and  may be, we will come back.

NEW HOTEL, GOOD ROOM BUT WITHOUT CLOSET, WITH ONLY SMALL SPACE TO PUT CLOTHES DOWN. THEY ADVERTISED A SWIMMING POOL IN THE ROOFTOP BUT IT PROVED TO BE A DISAPPOINTMENT SINCE IT WAS IN REALITY A LONG TANK 50 CM DEEP WHERE IT WAS OBVIOUSLY IMPOSSIBLE TO TAKE A SHOWER WORTHY OF THE NAME, MUCH LESS SWIM. SPACE SURROUNDING THE POOL IN THE BEDDING AREA VERY TIGHT WITH VERY LITTLE SPACE BETWEEN BEDS. LONG AND LONG QUEUES UNTIL RECEPTION TO ACCESS BREAKFAST.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Had a classic room on 7th floor facing sea and town. Upgraded to large balcony. Staff very friendly, service always good. Breakfast buffet and cooked orders excellent. Cipriani excellent for dinner 140 euros, smart casual, dining inside as balcony closed since early Nov. Pool heated to 25 degrees, not busy. Good free wifi in room. Concierge always helpful. Free bus into town every hour but stops at 6pm. Walk to restaurants in old town easy downhill 40 minutes. Taxi back to hotel 4-7 euros depending on time and place in town. Funchal cafes and bars reasonable prices, good restaurants are 70-100 euros incl wine  for a couple. Weather dry max 21 min 17 during stay this week 3-7th Dec.

This resort just doesn‚Äôt deliver. The staff are lovely and clearly trying very hard. However, there‚Äôs a lot of confusion amongst the team (for example, front desk said we didnt need a reservation for the one smart restaurant, then we rocked up and were summarily turned away). The service is painfully slow, which is charming in its way but wears thin after a while. The rooms are a bit of a shocker, with the toilet and shower out in the open, with only a bit of frosted glass around each leaving very little ‚Äúto the imagination‚Äù. The website says there‚Äôs a shuttle to Funchal, but it only makes one round trip a day and we didn‚Äôt meet any other guests who were able to make it work for them. Taxis into the main town come to ‚Ç¨120 round trip, so you‚Äôre a bit stranded here. It‚Äôs a good effort, but doesn‚Äôt add up in the end

Really clean rooms - very large and spacious and great views of the sea. Very comfortable. Only downside is that outside pools are too cold really to swim in - slight edge taken off one of them. The inside pool is heated a bit but still not v warm.Resort currently building hotel behind and to the right the other hotel is having renovation works so drilling sounds for most of the day so a bit noisy !Evening entertainment -singers etc in piano bar of a good standard.

We are a timeshare onwer at this hotel, but i would like to tell that we love it.  It is  a very relaxing place. This hotel has a feeling of space and peace.  The pools are wonderful (one is warm, the other a bit cooler, which is great on a warm day).  We found the staff very nice and helpful.  It is situated near the harbour and about 15-20 minutes walk from the town centre with a multitude of restaurants, all as good as each others.We are very happy to go back there and we enjoy every minutes of it.

Lovely hotel great location, right on beach front.Room lovely but don‚Äôt like glass window looking from bedroom to toilet took us 2 days to realise that blind was broken that suppose to obscure  it.Only found that out when asked if we could change rooms to a toilet that was not on show. It did get fixed and we left blind down rest of our stay.Breakfast was lovely with lots of choice.We did find soft drinks & alcohol very expensive in hotel couple of examples can of coke ‚Ç¨3 but only ‚Ç¨1 in most restaurants on marina, Somersby cider 1 pint ‚Ç¨7 in hotel but down marina ‚Ç¨3.50 - ‚Ç¨4.50 tops.Breakfast staff & bar staff, door men and pool men very friendly, but found reception staff bar 1 lady  not so friendly or helpful, and maybe need to crack a smile. A few times we approached staff to ask about area and buses but ended up having to find out information ourselves, due to lack of information from staff and not very helpful. With no eye contact.This was commented to us by a few guests with same opinion.Location is lovely with lots of restaurants we stayed 11 nights and tried a different restaurant each night and never had a bad meal once.Would I stay here again? yes but would hope on my return reception staff could be a bit more happy give you eye contact and be a bit more helpful.

Perfect hotel, clean bright decent sized rooms and breathtakingly beautiful views (side sea view) outstanding customer service, all the staff were very pleasant and helpful, excellent breakfast. The grounds were well kept. The area was relatively quiet and peaceful during our winter break.

We stayed here with friends at the end of April. Although we arrived much earlier than the standard check-in time, our rooms were ready which was a very good start.  A spacious room, well furnished and spotlessly clean. Beautiful bathroom. We asked the porter for some extra hangers and also cups and saucers with tea, coffee, milk.  These items were delivered straight away. Very comfy bed.The pool area and grounds are attractively furnished, comfortable and well kept with plenty of places to lounge around. Beach towels are plentiful and issued free on request from the front desk.Very pleasant, helpful staff.The restaurant is brilliant and has the most appetising buffet of any I have experienced. The staff are friendly and attentive.  At both breakfast and dinner there is a huge selection of hot and cold food, beautifully presented, fresh and delicious. At breakfast I particularly liked the freshly made omelettes available to order while you watch - very nice.  At dinner there are also freshly made pasta or rice dishes.White wine served well chilled and left on side in ice bucket.We were there on a half board basis and not once were we bored with the selection.A delightful place to stay and just a short walk from the marina where there are some lovely places to stop for a drink or snack and soak up the sunshine.All in all a very nice, relaxing holiday and we will definitely go back.

Lovely hotel ,such friendly staff and plenty of food choices.Would definitely stay again.We travelled on the October bank holiday weekend so only downside was the weather wasn't great but because we went all inclusive in the hotel we were happy to stay around,the hotel is situated practically on the beach and just 5 minutes walk from the new town.The only downside was the entertainment was stopped at that time of year in the hotel but other than that small observation I can't fault the hotel at all.
Lovely hotel with very friendly staff and great views of vineyards and cliffs. Very quiet.

Our experience in the Palacete was simply amazing. The historical building is full of artworks but is also a very cozy and relaxing place. The dining room is one of a kind and the food is all about comfort and taste. And of course, don't forget to try every single chocolate, simply yummy!!!The owners, Sandra and Mois√©s were great and made us feel at home. We will definitely come back!

Booked this as an independent traveller. It is definately the staff and the owner that make this hotel so special. Nothing is too much trouble , advice is forthcoming on every aspect of Madeira . This was especially helpful as this was our first trip. The fruit & juices for breakfast were fresh and plentiful just the ticket for walking the Lavadas.The hotel is deducted one point for allowing smoking on the balconies , excruciating if one has two chain smokers underneath who light up at 0630.Managed to fit us in for an extra night when Monarch did not operate and the flights were cancelled due high winds at FunchalTip : TUI have first call on the bookings at this hotel , check them out first

Great base for walkers on the outskirts of the village. Room and bed were comfy, evening meals by arrangement were three courses with wine, very filling with good conversation by the owners who speak English and Portugese. Nothing was too much bother for them, I can only speak highly of them.

We stayed there for 4 nights end of February - first days in March.  It is a quiet hotel with very friendly staff and a great location in Porto if you want to be learn a lot about Porto wine and want to be near to Ribeira and the river Douro.  The breakfasts are ver good too.  I would go back. We prefer to book hotels directly with the hotel.

This guesthouse is an absolute must visit when you want to stay in Porto. With only four rooms a lovely and quiet place in the middle of town. Beautiful renovated building. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Great bathroom. Each day a different excellent breakfast. Brigitte and Andre made every effort making our stay unforgettable. Don't hesitate to book this beautiful spot!

I spent two weeks at this hotel and enjoyed every minute. It is small, very clean, not by any means luxurious, but what makes it so perfect is ithe location and wonderful staff. The hotel has 35 rooms which are small but have everything you need bar tea and coffee making facilities. The receptionists will help in any way they can and the poolside and bar staff are very attentive. The location in the old town is an added bonus. We spoke to many residents and most return every year and not one had a bad word to say.We were delayed 48 hours and Thompson relocated us to one of their own, larger hotels in the New Town. Although it was very nice, there was none of the local atmosphere and loads of noise from the neighbouring building site.

We absolutely enjoyed our stay at Canto de Luz and would recommend to our friends and family.  The staff is very welcoming and attentive.  You can't tell by the facade, but the inside is really nice and warm.  The rooms are large and different (we stayed in 2 different rooms during our stay) with nice big windows allowing lots of sunlight to enter.

Nice hotel very clean. Rooms are good with a fridge which was very useful. You have to ask for tea/coffee making facilities tgey dont come as standard. Rooms cleaned daily to a good standard.Great location 5 minute (if that) walk to the river, where there are lots of bars and restaurants. Walk across the Roman bridge to more bars/restaurants seems to be cheaper the other side?!We didn't spend much time in the hotel. Breakfast was good lots of choice, can get very busy but staff always around.Good pool but not heated and it was freezing! Small but adequate gym.To access the beach you catch a ferry from the river √¢‚Äö¬¨2 return per person, takes about 10 mins. The beach is lovely and large, sunlounget to rent √¢‚Äö¬¨12 for 2 and a parasol.Bars and restaurants there as well.Well worth a visit to Barril beach we got a taxi there then walked across.Tavira is a beautiful town with old buildings and cobbled streets. It's still very portugese which we loved. Not a lively party town.Would recommend as a good base and we would return.

The place is full of charme and everyone is super friendly and helpful. The breakfast is prepared with cared and it is a good introduction to portuguese products. Canto de luz is walking distance from all Porto's main attractions and very close to several metro stations. Also, around the corner you will be able to find plenty of restaurants and bars, even though  rua do almada is super peaceful.

Last weekend me and my boyfriend stayed at this wonderful hotel. My boyfriend booked it as a suprise because he was planning to ask me to marry him there, and he couldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have made a better choice!When I saw the stunning views we had from our room I felt overwhelmed and the service we got was just fantastic. The staff was super super nice and helpful. They even had the detail of sending us a sparkling wine bottle for us to celebrate! (Because of course I said I do.)I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve been several times to Lisbon and would definitely recommend this hotel for the best stay, it is simply perfect!

Bura√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s beacon was burning bright long before landing with √¢‚Ç¨ÀúTeam Bura√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ in resort.  Professional, planned and efficient email exchange ensured all questions were answered, giving confidence prior to arrival.  Greeted by Nick (later to discover he was our PT for our boot camp sessions), we were shown around and made to feel very welcome.Bura is located in a residential area in Lagos with a 15-20 minute walk to the nearest beach and about the same to the town centre; the town√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s supermarket is only a 5-10 minute walk (very handy!).We had a jam packed itinerary full of fun and laugher, met lots of lovely like-minded people and shared some great memories (laughs included!).Nick kicked off our boot camp in normal PT style in our roof top session √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú it was awesome, he listened and took everyone√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s ability into account and encouraged each of us to do a little better than we thought we could.  I loved our PT session on the beach √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú It was a perfect location and Nick ensured an equal flexibility between fun and fitness.We hiked, shared local cheese and wine while watching the sunset, embraced surfing, we were coached to ensure we got the most from our day; we shared a picnic lunch and indulged in SUP Paddle boarding √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú all very exciting activities bring with them individual challenges.  We were picked up and transported to each location, taking the hassle away from organising this for ourselves √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú ideal.Our days were followed by relaxing evenings and candlelit yoga sessions with Miri, she was amazing, such a lovely soul, her energy oozed peace and tranquillity.Refuelling after our activity-filled days was so important and √¢‚Ç¨ÀúTeam Bura√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ made sure we were well looked after, seriously amazing food, so yummy.Getting a good night√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s sleep was also very important; the rooms were basic yet, welcoming, clean and comfortable.  We opted to pay a small supplement for a room on our own.Fabulous experience √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú thank you √¢‚Ç¨ÀúTeam Bura√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú without your hard work and organisation √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú the boot camp wouldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have ran so smoothly.

This wonderful B&B is one of our all-time favorite lodging experiences, and we have stayed in many five star properties. Great attention to detail has been paid to create an atmosphere of warmth and sophistication. The staff (particularly Filipa) and owner go to great lengths to make sure every need you might have is met with the upmost professionalism and efficiency. The food for breakfast was fantastic and there are many options for dining within walking distance. The location of the property is perfect, on a lively pedestrian street and within easy walking distance of the major sites.  Highly recommend!
Good experience at the Mexican restaurant with employee Tidjana. To repeat without doubt.  Good Mexican Food Good Mood

Sintra Marmoris Camelia Hotel is a lovely small boutique hotel located in old Sintra within walking distance to the sights.  The rooms are unique, large, well-appointed with stunning d√©cor, large bathrooms, with stunning views of the castle and greenbelt.The location is perfect! The concierge will help plan a nice day of sightseeing, transportation or dinning in the area. They are extremely helpful always greeting you with a smile and willingness to help. Breakfast was yummy and is made to order in a lovey setting either inside or outside on the patio. In the afternoon, their sister property offers wine tasting for the guests at both properties.Thank you ‚Äì The Team at Jetsetz

This was booked as a last minute holiday i emailed the hotel to ask for a top floor if possible this didnt happen which i understand but someone else asked for a top floor while we were there and got it.The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were very comfortable with plenty of room we were in block d, the food was ok especially breakfast but everything was always cold but the microwave came in handy.The main problem we had was you couldnt get a cold drink before 11 in the morning and the bar shut at 10 at night it didnt bother us too much but never had that in an allinclusive before.All in all not too many complaints just a few imrovements could be made.Also it says on there website they dont do stag &hen parties but there was at least 2 while we were there and also try the kebas between 3 & 5 they were awsome

The setting was even more stunning than the website would lead you to believe. The room was impeccable - clean, modern, comfortable, stylish. I would chose this place based on this alone. But the secret surprise - and it‚Äôs huge - is the food. The hotel offers four and eight course tasting menus with wine pairings that are next level. And are offered only to guests. As a foody and New Yorker, I can say honestly this was among the best meals of my life.

This hotel is modern so don't go expecting authentic Portuguese accommodation.  However, this is an excellent base for visiting Lisbon with its location of only a 4 minute walk to the Metro (Marques de Pombal, station) and its connections to all the interesting parts of Lisbon (blue line), plus the airport via the orange line.  The hotel is spotlessly clean, with decent sized rooms, although wardrobe space is limited.  Beds are very comfortable - quite firm.  There is a restaurant but I wouldn't recommend this.  It's a bit expensive and the food is not that great.  Eat out for a more Portuguese experience!

We were greeted warmly at the door by wonderful staff. The room was very well organized, well equipped, and charming. Very impressive and well thought out. Don't hesitate to stay here when visiting Porto!

The Pestana Bahia Praia is a perfect family hotel. We spent nine days there and enjoyed every moment.We had a very spacious apartment with a constant ocean breeze; everything was clean. The children were happy in the pool with a very deep section and we all enjoyed playing on the beach and in the ocean. The location of the hotel is also perfect. In the middle of the island, on the most beautiful beach.There was delicious food at every dinner, always fresh fish and seafood for us and pasta for our children. We loved the selection of salads every night.The best part was the staff. Everyone was helpful, always smiling.I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: The location is near from city center by metro, around 3 stops. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, air conditionals. The elevator was a bit still old fashion able to load only 4 people with carriers. The staff were kind and helpful and parking place is available with 11 EUR per day.

We had a wonderful stay at Pestana Viking Hotel & Spa! The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Everyone, from reception to the restaurant and cleaning team, made us feel so welcome. Excellent service and beautiful surroundings ‚Äî highly recommend!Staffs were really great, they went above and beyond to make our stay special.I would definitely go there again. Only suggestion if you like to enjoy the view and place more avoid peak season. We went end of september so it was really peacful.There are beaches on either side of the resort which is very convenient and easy accessible. Just enjoyed every bit..!
We have been to The Cliff Bay many times and always have a lovely relaxing time.  The staff are extremely efficient, friendly and cheerful with a great sense of humour.

Hotel with a good quality / cost relation. Most part of the rooms with view to Mondego river. Although near a train railway, no noise is listened. The breakfast is very complete and served in a long and beatiful room.

Brilliant, brilliant hotel & some of the best staff you will meet. We stayed here for 11 nights in September 2023 & loved the hotel, loved its location only 100m from the beach. Highly recommended you visit this area & consider staying in this hotel. Ideal for a quiet, relaxing & comfortable stay. A great base to explore Portimao, Alvor & many of the little villages around the area. The Team lead by Jo√£o Gomes will ensure your stay is 5 stars. Newly opened/refurbished, so has that great new hotel look, smell & feel. Has the feel of an upmarket boutique hotel with some lovely touches in the rooms, such as electric blackout blinds & funky showers.

Don't get me wrong, we stayed in a number of historical hotels and Posada's through out Portugal, but Vila Gale was a breath of fresh air. The pool is huge, rooms were well appointed and the whole hotel was very modern. You can walk to all the sites in Coimbra (great city to visit).

A wonderful New Year's Eve.Quality of the menu, very attentive staff and a great atmosphere.It's a perfect New Year's Eve for groups of friends and families, even with small children.And the Brunch the next day was magnificent.It is an experience to be repeated for sure.

We recently stayed at Hotel dosTemplarios for two nights when visiting Portugal. The hotel was in a great location, and we had an amazing view of the Castle. The room was clean and we loved our balcony. As our stay was in April , we found the outdoor pool to cold, but the indoor pool was good. We definitely would return. Only negatives to our stay are as follows. With the number of tour buses that come in, the morning breakfast buffet was always crazy if you wanted to eat 7:00 a.m. to 8:00a.m.  Breakfast food was just okay. The bar prices were a bit high considering wine in Portugal is relatively cheap. Tomar is amazing and would definitely recommend this hotel.
